bgameb package

bgameb.base module

Base constructs for build package objects

bgameb.base.log_enable(log_path: str = './logs/game.log', log_level: str = 'DEBUG') → None[source]

Enable logging

Parameters

  • log_path (str, optional) – path to log file. Defaults to ‘./logs/game.log’.

  • log_level (str, optional) – logging level. Defaults to ‘DEBUG’.

class bgameb.base.Base(id: str, other: ~typing.Optional[~dataclasses_json.utils.CatchAllVar] = <factory>, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>)[source]

Bases: DataClassJsonMixin

Base class for game, stuff, tools players and other stuff

Attr:

  • id (str): id of stuff

  • other (Dict[str, Any]): all other data, added to instance

    at declaration

  • counter (Counter): counter object

  • _to_relocate (dict[str, str): mapping for relocation any data

    to attributes inside dataclass. You can use names of attributes or methods of class for this mapping.

Counter is a collection.Counter

id: str
other: Optional[CatchAllVar]
counter: Counter

class bgameb.items.Dice(id: str, other: ~typing.Optional[~dataclasses_json.utils.CatchAllVar] = <factory>, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, count: int = 1, sides: int = 2, mapping: dict[int, typing.Any] = <factory>, last: ~typing.Optional[list[int]] = None, last_mapped: ~typing.Optional[list[typing.Any]] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseItem, DataClassJsonMixin

Rolled or fliped objects, like dices or coins.

Sides attr define number of sides of roller. Default to 2. Sides can’t be less than 2.

Example:
    dice = Dice('coin', sides=2)
Attr:

  • count (int): count of items. Default to 1.

  • sides (int): sides of dice or coin. Default to 2.

  • mapping(dict[int, Any]): nonnumerik mapping of roll result.

Raises

  • StuffDefineError – number of sides less than 2.

  • StuffDefineError – mapping keys is not equal of roll range.

count: int = 1
sides: int = 2
mapping: dict[int, Any]
last: Optional[list[int]] = None
last_mapped: Optional[list[Any]] = None
roll() → list[int][source]

Roll and return result

Returns

result of roll

Return type

List[int]

roll_mapped() → list[Any][source]

Roll and return mapped result

Returns

result of roll

Return type

list[Any]

class bgameb.items.Card(id: str, other: ~typing.Optional[~dataclasses_json.utils.CatchAllVar] = <factory>, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, count: int = 1, opened: bool = False, tapped: bool = False, side: ~typing.Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseItem, DataClassJsonMixin

Card object

Attr:

  • count (int): count of items. Default to 1.

  • opened (bool): is card oppened. Default to False.

  • tapped (bool): is card tapped. Default to False.

  • side (str, optional): the side of tap. Default to None.

Example:
    card = CardType('unique_card')
    card.tap(side='left')
count: int = 1
opened: bool = False
tapped: bool = False
side: Optional[str] = None
flip() → Card[source]

Face up or face down the card regardles of it condition

Returns

Card

Face up the card

Returns

hide() → Card[source]

Face down the card

Returns

tap(side='right') → Card[source]

Tap the card to the given side

Parameters

side (str, optional) – side to tap. Defaults to ‘right’.

Returns

Card

untap() → Card[source]

Untap the card

Returns

Card

alter() → NoReturn[source]

Many cards have alter views. For example card can have main view, that apply most time of the game and second view, that apply only if card played as that alternative. For ease of understanding, consider that different views of the same card are not related directly to each other.

class bgameb.tools.Deck(id: str, other: ~typing.Optional[~dataclasses_json.utils.CatchAllVar] = <factory>, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, c: ~bgameb.base.Component[~bgameb.items.Card] = <factory>, current: ~collections.deque[~bgameb.items.Card] = <factory>, last: ~typing.Optional[~bgameb.items.Card] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseTool, DataClassJsonMixin

Deck object

Deck ia a Bag subclass that contains Cards for define curent game deque.

You can add cards, define it counts and deal a deck. Result is saved in current deck attr as deque object. This object has all methods of python deque

Attr:

  • current (Deque[Card]): current cards deque.

Example:
    deque(Card1, Card3, Card2, Card4)
current: deque[Card]
c: Component[Card]
last: Optional[Card] = None
add(stuff: Card) → None[source]

Add stuff to component

Parameters

stuff (Card) – game stuff

clear() → None[source]

Clear the current and last of Deck

appendleft(item: Card) → None[source]

Add card to the left side of the current deck.

Parameters

item (Card) – a card object

extendleft(items: Iterable[Card]) → None[source]

Extend the left side of the current deck by appending cards started from the right side of iterable. The series of left appends results in reversing the order of cards in the iterable argument.

Parameters

items (Iterable[Card]) – iterable with cards

pop() → Card[source]

Remove and return an item from the current. If no cards are present, raises an IndexError.

Returns

an item object

Return type

Item

popleft() → Card[source]

Remove and return a card from the left side of the current deck. If no cards are present, raises an IndexError.

Returns

a card object

Return type

Card

rotate(n: int) → None[source]

Rotate the current deck n steps to the right. If n is negative, rotate to the left.

Parameters

n (int) – steps to rotation

Search for cards in current deck

Parameters

  • query (Dict[str, int]) – dict with id of searched cards and count of searching

  • remove (bool) – if True - remove searched cards from current deck. Default to True.

Returns

list of find cards

Return type

List[Card]

Example:
    game.deck1.search(
        {'card1': 2,
         'card2': 1 },
        remove=False
        )
get_random(count: int = 1, remove: bool = True) → list[bgameb.items.Card][source]

Get random cards from current deck

Parameters

  • count (int, optional) – count of random cards. Defaults to 1.

  • remove (bool, optional) – if True - remove random cards from current deck. Default to True.

Returns

list of random cards

Return type

List[Card]
